answers.answer: Med Help now has PHR (Personal Health Records).  You can transfer much of your data there, and perhaps keep it all organized that way.You shouldn't need to haul around all your records for every appt.  If you  have a specialist that needs some record from another MD, you can simply sign a release and have your records from that doctor sent directly to the requesting doctor.Most of the time, they really only need relatively current records, anyway.  Such as those from within the past year.

question: Hello Everyone, I am a diabetic patient and having diabetes since last six years. So, since then till today I have got lots of prescriptions and other such medical records. The problem is that at any time one of the previous records gets needed for my further treatment and it really becomes bulky to take them all. They are really very difficult to maintain also as there are a numerous of them. I wanted to know that if there are any possible ways to get out of this problem of handling that much bulky hard data or bulky medical records?
title: How to manage the previous medical records?
